ygData.subject: problem with fortran interface
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I use the Reactor Object on Linux platform (on fortran 90 with absoft ver 8.2a). When I try to compile a program : program main use cantera implicit none

Hi,

I use the Reactor Object on Linux platform (on fortran 90 with absoft=

ver 8.2a). When
I try to compile a program :

program main
	use cantera
	i=
mplicit none
	type(phase_t) gas
	type(reactor_t) reactr
	integer nsteps,ica=
lcul
	double precision :: tm,dt
	double precision :: energie_interne,energi=
e_interne_init,m_w
	double precision :: t,p
	integer :: nsp,ich4,io2,in2,iw=
,iinit
	double precision :: nich4,nio2,nin2
	double precision, dimension(10=
00) :: x
	character(len=3D10),dimension(1000) :: names
	gas=3DimportPhase('=
gri30.cti', 'gri30')
	nsp=3DnSpecies(gas)
	nsteps=3D1000
	ich4=3DspeciesInd=
ex(gas,'CH4')
	io2=3DspeciesIndex(gas,'O2')
	in2=3DspeciesIndex(gas,'N2')
	=
call getElementNames(gas, names)
	tm=3D0.
	t=3D1200
	p=3DoneAtm
	do iinit=
=3D1,nsp
	   x(iinit)=3D0
	end do
	x(ic8h18)=3D1
	x(io2)=3D(1.+4./4.)
	x(in=
2)=3D(1.+4./4.)*3.76
	call setState_TPX(gas,t,p,x)
	reactr=3Dstirred Reacto=
r()
	do icalcul=3D1,nsteps
	   if (icalcul=3D=3D1) then
	      energie_inte=
rne_init=3DintEnergy_mass(gas) 
	   end if
	   tm=3Dicalcul*dt
	   call adv=
ance(reactr,tm)
	end do
end program main

I get the following error. Has an=
yone encountered this error ?

type(reactor_t) reactr
     ^
cf90-126 f90fe=
: ERROR MAIN, File =3D reactor_01.f90, Line =3D 7, Column =3D 6
  Derived t=
ype "REACTOR_T" is used, but it does not have any
components defined for it=
.

p=3DoneAtm
  ^
cf90-113 f90fe: ERROR MAIN, File =3D reactor_01.f90, Line=
 =3D 30, Column =3D 3
  IMPLICIT NONE is specified in the local scope, ther=
efore an explicit
type must be specified for data object "ONEATM".

Thanks,=


Alberto.


For indications, Makefile :
#!/bin/sh

# the name of the execu=
table program to be created
PROG_NAME =3D demo

# the object files to be li=
nked together. 
OBJS =3D reactor_01.o

# additional flags to be passed to t=
he linker. If your program
# requires other external libraries, put them he=
re
LINK_OPTIONS =3D 

#----------------------------------------------------=
-----------------------
# You probably don't need to edit anything below.

=
# the C++ compiler
CXX =3D g++

# C++ compile flags
CXX_FLAGS =3D -O3 -Wall=


# external libraries
EXT_LIBS =3D -lfct -lclib -lzeroD -ltransport -lcant=
era -lrecipes
-lcvode -lctlapack -lctblas -lctmath -ltpx -lg2c -lstdc++ 

#=
 the Fortran 90/95 compiler
F90 =3D /opt/absoft/bin/f95

# Fortran compile =
flags
FORT_FLAGS =3D -p. -p/usr/local/include/cantera -s -YEXT_NAMES=3DLCS
=
-YEXT_SFX=3D_ -YCFRL=3D1 -O3 -g 

# the directory where the Cantera librari=
es are located
CANTERA_LIBDIR=3D/usr/local/lib/cantera/1.6.0

# the directo=
ry where Cantera include files may be found.
CANTERA_INCDIR=3D/usr/local/in=
clude

# the directory where Cantera Fortran 90 modules may be found.
CANTE=
RA_MODULE_DIR=3D/usr/local/include/cantera

# flags passed to the C++ compi=
ler/linker for the linking step
LCXXFLAGS =3D -L$(CANTERA_LIBDIR) 

# how t=
o compile C++ source files to object files
%.o : %.cpp
	$(CXX) -c $< -I$(CA=
NTERA_INCDIR) $(CXX_FLAGS)

# how to compile Fortran 90/95 source files to =
object files
%.o : %.f90
	$(F90) -c $< -I$(CANTERA_MODULE_DIR) $(FORT_FLAGS=
)

PROGRAM =3D $(PROG_NAME)$(EXE_EXT)

DEPENDS =3D $(OBJS:.o=3D.d)

all: $(=
PROGRAM)

$(PROGRAM): $(OBJS)
	$(F90) -o $(PROGRAM) $(OBJS) $(LCXXFLAGS) $(=
CANTERA_LIBS)
$(LINK_OPTIONS) $(EXT_LIBS)  

%.d : %.cpp
	g++ -MM -I$(CANTE=
RA_INCDIR) $*.cpp > $*.d

clean:
	$(RM) $(OBJS) $(PROGRAM)

depends: $(DEPE=
NDS)
	cat *.d > .depends
	$(RM) $(DEPENDS) 

TAGS: 
	etags *.h *.cpp

ifeq =
($(wildcard .depends), .depends)
include .depends
endif
